headline.main: THE LEGISLATIVE EXCURSION.; FESTIVITIES AT NIAGARA FALLS. Speeches of ex-Governor Hunt, Senator Seward and others.

docs.lead_paragraph: Just as the hand on the dial pointed to the hour of 3, the doors of the ample dining room of the Cataract House were thrown open, and the invited guests, without any extraordinary noise or confusion, took their seats.
docs.snippet: Just as the hand on the dial pointed to the hour of 3, the doors of the ample dining room of the Cataract House were thrown open, and the invited guests, without any extraordinary noise or confusion, took their seats.

byline.original: Specially Reported for the New-York Daily Times:

headline.main: CITY REFORM.; GRAND MASS MEETING IN THE PARM. Speeches of James T. Brady, Daniel E. Sickles, John Cochran, &c. NEETINGS IN DIFFERENT PARTS OF THE CITY. Large Turnouts---Great Enthusiasm. Meeting of the Citizens of the Tenth Ward. Meeting of Citizens of the Seventh Ward. Meeting of Up-town Citizens. A Last Appeal to the Citizens of New-York for City Reform.

docs.lead_paragraph: In response to a call from the Young Mens' Democratic Club, a large meeting was held last evening in the Park, of those favorable to the amendments proposed to the City Charter. A platform was erected for the accommodation of the speakers and reporters; a band was also stationed there, and at intervals performed several airs.
docs.abstract: At the Dem. City Reform meeting

headline.main: RURAL ECONOMY.; Cleanings of Fact and Practice in Fruit Culture. The Strawberry.

docs.lead_paragraph: GENERAL REMARKS.--This fruit is a native of the temperate latitutdes, its name originating either in the practice formerly in vogue of placing straw upon and about the plants, in order to insure health and cleanliness, or from an old method of threading the berries on straws of grass, in which shape they were brought from the woods.

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; LAW LIBRARY FOR KINGS COUNTY. MORTAILITY. THE BONES OF THE MARTYRS. SABBATH SCHOOL EXCURSION. ANOTHER HIGHWAY ROBBERY. SERIOUS ACCIDENT. A WARNING TO BOYS. ABANDONED. TAKEN BACK. FURIOUS DRIVING. CITY COURT KINGS COUNTY COURT OF OYER AND TERMINER. SPECIAL TERM OF CIRCUIT COURT COURT CALENDAR
HAVANA.; Robbery of the British Consulate--Mr. William Sidney Smith--Arrival of Coolies--Slaves--Business.

byline.original: Correspondence of the New-York Daily Times

docs.lead_paragraph: ARTHUR SPRING, THE PHILADELPHIA MURDERER.--The Philadelphia Bulletin on Saturday, has an account of a visit to the conviet SPRING, whose execution is close at hand: "We paid a visit to the Moyamensing prison yesterday afternoon, for the purpose of seeing ARTHUR SPRING. We found the condemned man in good health and cheerful spirits.

headline.main: BROOKLYN CITY.; BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH. CONSTABLES. LONG ISLAND RAILROAD. FATAL ACCIDENT. ASSAULT AND BATTERY WITH INTENT TO KILL. FIRST TARGET EXCURSION. THIRTEENTH REGIMENT. FOUND DROWNED. BROOKLYN CITY DISPENSARY. FIRE. COURTS. FIREMENS' VISIT. HIGHWAY ROBBERS ARRESTED. ACCIDENT TO THE CROTON TROOPERS STORMING THE GATE DROWNED. SUICIDE BY HANGING. AN ESCAPED PRISONER ARRESTED. ATTEMPT TO COMMIT SUICIDE. STEALING. SERIOUS ACCIDENT. DISEASED MEAT. MALICIOUS CONDUCT. HORSE KILLED BY LIGHTNING.

docs.lead_paragraph: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH.--The first meeting of this Board was held on Friday at the City Hall. Present, his Honor the Mayor, and Aldermen MORRIS, HIMMAN, and NEELY.
docs.snippet: BROOKLYN BOARD OF HEALTH.--The first meeting of this Board was held on Friday at the City Hall. Present, his Honor the Mayor, and Aldermen MORRIS, HIMMAN, and NEELY.

headline.main: CITY REFORM.; GRAND DEMONSTRATION AT METROPOLITAN HALL. Speeches of Judge Vanderpool, Hon. Benj. F. Butler, and others.

docs.lead_paragraph: In pursuance to a requisition, signed by some of the most respectable and influential citizens of New-York, a grand mass meeting of the taxpayers convened on Saturday evening for the purpose of taking counsel in regard to the new Charter, to be voted upon next Tuesday.

docs.lead_paragraph: To the Editor of the New-York Daily Times : Shall we have a Park ! While all we hear answer in the affirmative, no action is taken by our legislators to realize the wishes or necessities of our people. It took a long time to effect the introduction of the Croton. Everybody felt its need, but nobody had for years the will to act.
